title.narrative: Women's Voices for Peaceful Democratic Dialogue in the Democratic Republic of the Congo

description.narrative: The project seeks to increase women's access to media and information in order to promote their participation in public decision-making processes. Activities include: 1) working to enhance women's knowledge and understanding of their political rights and opportunities to participate in public decision-making; 2) building the capacity of womens civil society organizations; and 3) training media to report more inclusively and sensitively to improve the representation of women's voices in the public debate.

title.narrative: PR10390149: PNC ENGLISH TRAINING AT CALI

description.narrative: PR10390149: PNC ENGLISH TRAINING AT CALI Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

title.narrative: Protecting Women and Girls from Gender-Based Violence and Human Trafficking in North and South Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo

description.narrative: Free the Slaves, an international anti-slavery organization, is partnering with four Congolese civil society organizations to establish and implement a community-based program to: 1) increase the GBV resistance of 15 communities in North and South Kivu; 2) increase knowledge of GBV, child slavery, and trafficking in persons (TIP) as well as increase action by traditional and religious leaders and government officials at local and provincial levels; 3) improve access to basic socio-economic rights and services for survivors of GBV, child slavery, and TIP; and 4) strengthen the Civil Society Coalition against Slavery in its efforts to combat GBV and TIP.

title.narrative: PR10701086 ENGLISH LGE PROGRAM TO JUDICIAL POLICE

description.narrative: PR10701086 ENGLISH LGE PROGRAM TO JUDICIAL POLICE Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

title.narrative: Department of State - Peacekeeping Operations: Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) Military Assistance

description.narrative: To support efforts to transform the military of the DRC (FARDC) to a professional, conventional force, including training of officers at the officer professionalization school in Kinshasa, advisors/mentors, refurbishment of facilities, equipment, and training. In particular, funds supported training of the FARDC (including operations and maintenance training), refurbishment of the Officer Training Center, a military justice training program through the Defense Institute for International Legal Studies (DIILS), a Military Information Support Team (MIST) for eastern DRC, U.S. military advisors and trainers, equipment for the Light Infantry Unit (rapid reaction force), contract adviser for the Ministry of Defense, and a government technical monitor.

title.narrative: South Kivu Anti-Trafficking Partnership Program (SKAPP)

description.narrative: Heartland Alliance is enhancing victim protection efforts and raising awareness of trafficking in persons among vulnerable communities and key stakeholders in the DRC. Heartland Alliance is providing comprehensive services to victims of human trafficking, and, in collaboration with local partners, strengthening coordination and collaboration between civil society and the Government of the DRC by establishing a formal mechanism that enables diverse stakeholders to proactively identify victims of trafficking and refer them to appropriate care. Heartland Alliance is independently tracking and monitoring human trafficking cases; devising a unified system for documenting and collecting data that will be used to assess progress and inform recommendations to the Congolese government; and conducting public awareness campaigns to prevent human trafficking through community education and mobilization, innovative radio broadcasts, and training for community focal points.

title.narrative: PR10610615:INL:ENGLISH TRAINING AT CALI FOR STAFF

description.narrative: PR10610615:INL:ENGLISH TRAINING AT CALI FOR STAFF Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

description.narrative: PR10921373 PNC ENGLISH TRAINING @ CALI JUL-SEP 22 Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.
